meanings.definition: To make a deep inarticulate sound in response to pain or despair.
meanings.sent1: She groaned loudly when she stubbed her toe.
meanings.sent2: The injured dog groaned in pain.
meanings.sent3: After a long day at work, he groaned about his sore feet.
meanings.sent4: The old floorboards groaned under the weight of the heavy furniture.
meanings.sent5: The wind howled and the trees groaned in the storm.

meanings.definition: To utter a deep sound of pain or discomfort.
meanings.sent1: He groaned softly as he tried to sit up after the accident.
meanings.sent2: The wounded soldier groaned as the medic tended to his injuries.
meanings.sent3: The old car groaned as it struggled up the steep hill.
meanings.sent4: The tired engine groaned before finally starting.
meanings.sent5: The floorboards groaned under the weight of the heavy boxes.

meanings.sent1: She groaned about having to do her homework on a Friday night.
meanings.sent2: The child groaned about having to eat his vegetables.
meanings.sent3: He groaned about the long line at the grocery store.
meanings.sent4: The students groaned when they heard about the pop quiz.
meanings.sent5: The workers groaned about having to stay late to finish the project.
